answers.junior: IoC (Inversion of Control) container manages object creation and lifecycle in Spring. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
answers.middle: IoC container instantiates, configures, and assembles beans by reading configuration metadata. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. BeanFactory and ApplicationContext are main container types.
answers.senior: Container handles bean lifecycle from instantiation through initialization to destruction. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. ApplicationContext adds enterprise features like event propagation, AOP, and internationalization.
answers.tricky: Discuss BeanFactory vs ApplicationContext, container initialization, refresh mechanisms, and performance considerations. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
